title: Compatibility Checker
subtitle: Check if your tank inhabitants are compatible with each other
notInDatabaseInfo: The following species are not in our compatibility database. No checks were performed for them.
noLivestock: No active livestock in this tank to check
inlineCompatible: This species appears compatible with your current tank inhabitants.
inlineNoData: No compatibility data available for this species.

rules.aggression_conflict: {{speciesA}} ({{tempA}}) may conflict with {{speciesB}} ({{tempB}}). Aggressive species can stress or harm peaceful tankmates.
rules.reef_safety: {{speciesA}} is not reef-safe and may damage or eat {{speciesB}}.
rules.reef_safety_caution: {{speciesA}} has questionable reef safety. Monitor closely with {{speciesB}}.
rules.tank_too_small: {{species}} needs at least {{required}}L — this tank is only {{actual}}L.
rules.territorial_duplicates: Multiple {{species}} in the same tank may fight over territory.
rules.predator_prey: {{predator}} is a natural predator of {{prey}}. High risk of predation.
rules.size_disparity: {{large}} is much larger than {{small}}. The size difference poses a risk.
rules.water_type_conflict: {{species}} is a {{speciesWater}} species and may not thrive in a {{tankWater}} tank.
rules.specific_seahorse: Seahorses should be kept in species-only tanks. {{other}} may outcompete them for food or stress them.
rules.specific_axolotl: Axolotls are best kept alone or with their own species. {{other}} may nip at gills or be eaten.
rules.specific_betta_male: Multiple male Bettas will fight aggressively. Keep only one male per tank.
rules.specific_coral_war: {{speciesA}} and {{speciesB}} may engage in chemical warfare if placed too close.
rules.corallivore_conflict: {{speciesA}} feeds on coral and will damage {{speciesB}}.

info.title: How this works
info.description: This checker uses a built-in database of common aquarium species traits to check for aggression conflicts, reef safety, tank size, territorial disputes, and predator-prey relationships.
info.disclaimer: This is a guidance tool, not a guarantee. Individual behavior varies. Always research species thoroughly before adding them.
info.sources: Species traits are compiled from established references: FishBase.org (taxonomy, ecology, behavior), WoRMS (World Register of Marine Species), LiveAquaria care guides, Reef2Reef/ReefCentral community wikis, Eric Borneman's Aquarium Corals (coral allelopathy), and MASNA husbandry guidelines. Tank sizes reflect widely accepted minimums from the reef keeping community.

matrix.clickForDetails: Click a cell to see details

network.noConnections: No compatibility issues found between species
